clinical_study.brief_title: Role of the Pharmacist in Detection of Drug Interactions Before Antitumor Treatment Initiation
clinical_study.official_title: Role of the Clinical Pharmacist in an Oncology Ambulatory Center to Prevent Drug Related Problems Before Antitumor Treatment Initiation

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this observational study is to evaluate the benefits of a pharmacist integration in an oncology ambulatory center, to prevent drug related problems (in particular drug drug interactions) at antitumor treatment initiation.
The hypothesis of this work is that a drug drug interaction will be observed in 30% of cancer patients and will have a major clinical impact in 1% of the cases.
The primary endpoint is the prevalence of pharmacist interventions among cancer patients who are going to receive an oral targeted therapy (140 patients) or cancer chemotherapy or immunotherapy (300 patients).
Pharmacist interventions will be classified according to the SFPC (société française de pharmacie Clinique) classification.
The secondary endpoints are
- The detection of drug drug interactions with theriaque software, Micromedex software and DDI predictor tool.
- The clinical gradation by an independent expert comity of the clinical impact of avoided drug drug interaction. The expert comity will grade avoided clinical consequences in 3 levels (minor, moderate or major),
- The Economic evaluation of pharmacist intervention: Cost of the project to evaluate drug drug interaction and benefits after evaluation of avoided clinical consequences
- The Adherence evaluation of patients treated with oral cancer targeted therapy (Therefore, only patients under oral targeted therapy will be evaluated at Day0, Day15 ,Day 30 and Month 6 to determine adherence.)

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week from date of inclusion
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients whom antitumora treatment or usual treatment has been changed by the pharmacist intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week from date of inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: Number of drug drug interactions detected

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical gradation of drug drug interactions
secondary_outcome.description: Gradation by an independent experts comity of the clinical impact of prevented drug drug interaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost of the pharmacist intervention by avoided clinical consequence
secondary_outcome.description: Cost evaluation of pharmacist for analysis and medication review with patient by avoided interaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Potential cost of the avoided clinical consequences
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment cost of avoided clinical consequences , balanced with the probability of occurrence

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence evaluation with oral cancer targeted therapy by therapeutic drug monitoring
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 15, 30 and 6 months after oral therapy initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with plasma drug concentration below the 10th percentile will be classified as nonadherent patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence evaluation with oral cancer targeted therapy by the 6 item-Girerd Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 15, 30 and 6 months after oral therapy initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with a Girerd score greater than or equal to 3 will be classified as nonadherent patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence evaluation with oral cancer targeted therapy by pill count
secondary_outcome.description: Pill counts will be used to calculate the percent of total prescribed dose taken to prescribed during the 90-day period

study_pop.textblock: Cancer patients in outpatient setting, treated in two Paris hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- legal age patients
- Affiliated to social security or with another insurance system
- with a solid tumor
- who are going to receive an antitumor treatment (chemotherapy, immunotherapy or oral targeted therapy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant women
- minor patient
